remarks: A (closed) kernel expressed in terms of a nonzero vector in its orthocomplement.  TODO: consolidate lemmas unless they're needed for something else (in which case break out as theorems) (Contributed by NM, 2-Jan-2015.)
statement:
dochsnkr.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dochsnkr.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochsnkr.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochsnkr.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
dochsnkr.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dochsnkr.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
dochsnkr.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
dochsnkr.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dochsnkr.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
dochsnkr.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) \ { .0. } ) ) $.
dochsnkr $p |- ( ph -> ( L ` G ) = ( ._|_ ` { X } ) ) $.
